bill.title: AN ACT relating to suburban fire districts.
bill.description: Create new sections of KRS Chapter 75 to define terms; establish a process for switching an existing fire district to a suburban fire district; establish board composition, time of election, and provisions for officer elections of a suburban fire district; set revenue process for suburban fire district, allow for recovery of costs and expenses for certain responses when the recipients are not property owners subject to taxes, and apply provisions relating to compensating tax rates and recall; set the district's fiscal and transparency responsibilities; establish duties, activities, and responsibilities of the district; set forth the administrative hierarchy of the district in relation to the subordinate fire department; allow for the appointment of special firefighters; set out the responsibilities of fire chief of the district department; require department members to take oath and give bond; establish the political freedoms of members of district departments; establish disciplinary and due process procedures for members and employees of district; allow for appeals of decisions of board of trustees in disciplinary actions; require the fire chief of a district to attend board of trustees meetings; confer certain peace officer status to regular members of the department, excepting volunteer firefighters; require the secretary of the district to keep minutes of the board; allow the board of trustees to employ or retain an attorney; require the county attorney to advise on matters when requested by the board; establish meeting protocols of the board of trustees; allow for the erection of fire hydrants; provide that the district may retain taxes collected when none were due that remain unrefunded after two years; allow the board of trustees to enter into agreements for fire protection services, including between other governmental entities, and provide for certain immunity; set circumstances when firefighters are to be declared as serving in the line of duty; provide for no extra compensation under these circumstances; establish certain immunities of the district and personnel while in performance of duties; allow for the merger of suburban fire districts; assign a short title for the Act.
